Encapsulations for In-situ OAM Data Encapsulations for In-situ OAM Data
draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-04 draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-05
Abstract Abstract
In-situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) records In-situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) records
operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet
traverses a path between two points in the network. In-situ OAM is traverses a path between two points in the network. In-situ OAM is
to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or
other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-situ OAM other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-situ OAM
data fields can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment data fields can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment
Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension headers), and IPv4. Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension headers), and IPv4.
